reviews.text: This hotel is in Icmeler not Marmaris. It's located centrally so not too far to centre or beach which is great. The rooms are comfortable and clean , the pool is small but provides a welcome break from the heat of the day. As stated in numerous other reviews the staff are what make this place , we found that if you have time for them they will certainly respond and enhance your whole Icmeler experience . We will certainly see them all again next year .
reviews.title: Great location in icmeler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Devamli is a small, family-run hotel. It is centrally located within Içmeler. It is basic but clean. It suffers from the limitations of a building constructed some years ago with small rooms and on a landlocked site, which precludes much development. The erstwhile quiet road fronting the hotel has become very busy over the years, and the rooms have single glazing. The hotel is located on three floors over the ‘Love Boat’ restaurant and ‘Sports Inn’ bar. Hotel guests currently receive a 10% ‘loyalty-card-type’ kickback on purchases in the restaurant and bar, redeemable against further meals and drinks. During our stay, the guests were all British.
reviews.title: Basic but clean and central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a lift from reception to the three bedroom floors; but there are a dozen or so wide steps (with a central handrail) from street level to reception, and there are a couple of steps from the reception area to the sun terrace at the rear of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.text: Rooms at the west-facing rear of the building are relatively quiet (those on the lower floors may look out upon a plain wall), but those at the north end (right on entering the hotel) get noise from the road at the side. Those at the front are quite noisy. Although a lot of the music from bars etc. stops at midnight, there can be music, singing and animated conversations in the main street at the front of the hotel until about 3 am, and the real traffic begins at about 6 am with council roadsweepers and dustcarts with lifting and compaction equipment operating, and a procession of brewery drays etc. In between, there can be drunken couples having rows, coaches delivering new guests at all hours, and taxis disgorging passengers with doors wide open and radios blaring. Twin-bedded rooms have beds with soft edges, but the double beds have hard edges which, given the smallness of the rooms, can lead to barked shins etc. The showers are about 29” square, with a 13½“ step, so a bit restricting for some, but adequate and with plenty hot water. Rooms have safes (fee payable) and fridge mini-bars, and TVs. The room TV is a heavy, cubic object with a 14” screen, with poor reception and a lot of ‘snow’. The only English-language programme available was the BBC World News, which goes on and on about places in which few people have any interest, presented by people with squeaky voices and often poor English pronunciation. The most useful bit would probably be the rolling news banner across the bottom of the screen; but as the BBC World News logo covers about 40% of the bottom of the screen, by the time you’ve realised you are interested in an item, most of it has disappeared from view. If you don’t like BBC World News, next best may be ‘Euro News’ – in Turkish!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sun lounge affords a facility to bronze. However, there are no sun loungers; apart from two park-type benches, there are numerous plastic-covered single mattresses and pillows on the decking, with threadbare single fitted sheets supplied to cover them. Comfortable enough to lie on, but some may have difficulty in getting down on them, or having got down, in getting up again.
reviews.title: Decent Place
